HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!Weight gain with extreme hunger can be due to diabetes and this should be ruled out first. If you do not have diabetes then this could be due to severe acidity which is causing hunger and the extra you eat is causing weight gain.The best thing would be to consult a general practitioner or PCP and try and assess what is the cause of your problem. Then proper referral for concerned specialist can take things further and get you proper treatment. Take care!
